intro: Kryptostoma macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered kryptostoma, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. Kryptostoma macranthum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
